docs.lead_paragraph: CareFirst BlueCross BlueShield, which sells health insurance in Maryland, Virginia and the District of Columbia, said on Wednesday that a cyberattack compromised the data of 1.1 million current and former members.

docs.lead_paragraph: Nearly a quarter of U.S. adults who were insured all last year lacked adequate protection from big medical bills based on their income, according to Commonwealth Fund research.

docs.lead_paragraph: Tuesday's uncertain results in Kentucky's Republican primary for governor could delay the party's efforts to unite behind a candidate and give Democratic nominee Jack Conway a head start.

docs.lead_paragraph: There are no "one size fits all" issues for small business in the 2016 presidential campaign. docs.lead_paragraph: Missouri Gov. Jay Nixon announced Tuesday that insurer Aetna has agreed to pay $4.5 million for violations of state law that included paying for elective abortions when the women were not eligible under their policies, marking the largest insurance penalty in state history.

docs.lead_paragraph: The financial chief of Anthem Inc, the second-largest U.S. health insurer, said on Tuesday that low interest rates and other conditions make it a good time for an acquisition, adding to speculation about merger activity in the sector.
